reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived at the Dalton Inn & Suites late at night and was offered a choice of a boutique room or a standard and had a look at both. I picked the standard room as it was sufficient for my one night stay. The standard rooms are furnished with antique wood furniture and smaller room with windows that open.. The boutique rooms are furnished with antique wood furniture and have added furnishings such as an entertainment centre and a bigger tv as well as paintings on the wall. These rooms are also bigger and feature added amenities. The furnishings in these rooms are extremely nice. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful I would deffenately stay here again.
reviews.title: great hotel in victoria

reviews.text: I spend only 2 nights at this hotel for a very decent price $59.99/night. The location was great since it in the downtown area and the parking is for $10/night. The staff were friendly and check-in was quick.
reviews.title: good hotel for the price, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the room has very old and antique furniture. The wall wasn't really sound proof, people from the next room were talking and it was kinda annoying. Overall, the room was clean but nothing fancy at all.
reviews.title: Everything was EXCELLENT - I loved the Dalton Hotel

likes.liked: — clean, spacious and comfortable room - Downtown Victoria

reviews.title: Great Location !!
reviews.text: In conclusion, I would recommend this hotel for people looking to live in downtown area with low budgets.

reviews.title: Gret Hotel ,awsome customer service
reviews.text: What a great find !! The staff were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The Hotel itself was fantastic !! Our room was absolutely spotless, very comfortable with nice decor and we got a great price, above average service and a perfect location. Next time we are back in Victoria we will stay here again and of course will recommend it to others !!

We've stayed at the Dalton before, mainly because of it's location. The rooms are a bit of a crap shoot as the building is undergoing renovations and is quite old (est. 1876?). Your choices are the rooms facing an inner courtyard that are generally smaller and a little dark. Your other option is a street side room facing out on either Yates or Blanshard St. If possible avoid the Yates St. rooms especially on the weekend when the pub (and pub goers) can be quite loud well into the morning (still going until 3:00 a.m.) - if you're in the pub, no worries!
reviews.title: Nice Location, Some Problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms and sheets were clean (some dust) but seemed to be furnished with garage sale/yard sale distressed "antique" furniture. Sort of went with the age of the hotel but the ultimate feeling was of a hotel trying to look upscale with "retro" furnishing. Rooms were tastefully painted but definitely showing the age of the building. Hot water issues (already mentioned in other reviews) cleared up in the morning when the taps were run for 10 minutes or so. Note that the shower lever fell off when attempting to have a shower.
reviews.title: Centrally located and perfectly adequate though some maintenance issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is an issue - there are a few stalls and an extra charge of $10/day. Overflow parking is a block or so away.
reviews.title: Victoria in August

reviews.text: Some positives - location, location, location. Ideal for walking to the downtown shops, movie theatres across the street, opera house minutes away. Continental breakfast is pretty good, waffles, fruit, bagels, muffins, cereal, organic loose leaf tea, coffee, etc. The front desk staff were excellent and very helpful. We were traveling with a baby and a "crib" (playard) was provided at no cost.
reviews.title: Central location, good for a night

likes.liked: — The old style of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note that there is an "islander" rate which will drop your nightly stay to $78 if you can produce an ad generally found in community newspapers up-island. I'll probably try one of the other hotels with similar "islander" rates next time I'm in Victoria or go with a courtyard room.
reviews.title: decent budget hotel for right downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not enjoy our stay at all. Severe lack of sleep due to something banging against the door all night (turns out someone had tried to fix this before but it didn't work). The tv didn't work properly, it made a whinning noise on every channel and we could therefore not watch it. Met someone at reception at 6:30am when checking out and they were trying to find a new hotel, luckily we were only there one night and then moving on. The rooms were very dreary - they are very similar to the picture on their website but the website picture looks brighter and better. Only advantage to hotel was its location.
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.text: A wide range of problems best summarized as general room cleanliness is far from acceptable, attitude of service staff to problems is confrontational at best and maintenance of the building is poor. A selection of the issues we had, room is small and not decorated to any sort of standard deserving of the price, lighting and multiple electrical outlets not working, bathroom shower not able to hold a temperature, not able to get into the hotel after 1am as our room had a card not a key entry and I had to clean the AC inlet and outlet to get the system to work, one word to sum it up is grime.
reviews.title: Oh no....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not stay here again nor would I recommend it to any traveller as it will taint your view of a lovely city.
reviews.title: A good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you are paying very low rates for a hotel, you can't expect service or quality to match that of a four star hotel. No view and basic services are to be expected. This is what you will find at the Dalton. The room was clean and comfortable. It was small, but I have stayed at much smaller rooms in much more expensive hotels. There was plenty of room for the both of us. The ceiling fan in the room kept us cool and comfortable. The decor was nice and better than what you would find at a motel 6.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel - Basic Ammenities
expensive flop house
reviews.text: If I were traveling on a budget in Victoria, I wouldn't mind staying here again. The bathrooms do needs some work though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're going to victoria on a summer weekend, be prepared to pay through the nose for hotel stays. I opted for the Dalton because it was affordable ($115) and downtown. My summary -- very good customer service, but awful rooms.
reviews.title: Affordable, Good Customer Service, But Pretty Rough Accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was pretty good. Close to shopping, and China Town, and we walked to the Empress. Lots of coffee shops and book stores near by. Get a bus pass since many of the busses use Douglas st. as a major thoroughfare. We took the bus back and forth to Butchart for example - 40 minute drive.
reviews.title: Affordable but no luxury

reviews.text: Rooms were awful. We slept fine, but absolutely no frills and its dark and musty and the TV looks like its from the 80's. Its functional, but nothing much beyond that. Walls are paper thin.
reviews.title: Good value but terrible accomendations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One good thing, though, the young man and woman running the counter really went the extra mile with directions, bus info, early check-in. Very nice. They're in a tough situation, and they appear to know it.
reviews.title: Cute Hotel

reviews.text: The online photos for this place are a complete misrepresentation. An enterprising young lawyer could probably make hay with a false advertising claim, (as w/ lots of hotels.)
reviews.title: budget hotel

likes.liked: — quiet room, front desk staff helpful
